result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L. Anderson

records.addlTxt:
(3:00 PM cases 21CT216, 21CT314, 22CM29, 22CM326, 22CM475, 22CF636, 22CF1144, 22CF1145, 22CF1146, 21TR5416 called.) Defendant Brian L. Anderson in court. Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Brian L. Anderson. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court notes that the preliminary hearing or waiver of preliminary hearing needs to be addressed in cases 22CF1144, 22CF1145 and 22CF1146.
Attorney Schmidt advises those cases were originally filed as misdemeanor cases and elevated to felony cases.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearings in cases 22CF1144, 22CF1145 and 22CF1146.
Preliminary Hearing in cases 22CF1144, 22CF1145, 22CF1146 scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 1:30 pm.
 
Attorney Schmidt advises was just provided a victim request for bond modification in case 22CF636.
Attorney Schmidt has no objection to the victim's request and requests the court modify the bond.
State advises has reluctance but will agree to the bond modification request.
Court orders the no contact with D.J. is amended and is amended to contact with D.J. allowed via telephone and electronic means relating to child custody and placement issues only.

Attorney Schmidt advises the defendant has requested Attorney Schmidt withdraw from all cases and is seeking to obtain private counsel.
State takes no position on the request to have Attorney Schmidt withdrawn.
Court notes there is a trial set for next week and has a colloquy with the defendant regarding why he is requesting a new attorney.
Court denies the request for Attorney Schmidt to be withdrawn.

Attorney Schmidt advises is prepared to head to trial next week.
Court notes Attorney Schmidt has filed several motions today, which the Court hasn't fully reviewed yet.
Parties advise the motion in limine filed by each side are pretty standard. Court advises parties can address the motion in limine the morning of trial.
Attorney Schmidt advises has objections to 4 of the State's motion in limine.
Attorney Schmidt raises issues with prior convictions for the State's witnesses. State advises can provide Attorney Schmidt with updated information via email.
Attorney Schmidt advises has received the State's proposed jury instructions and has no issues with them. Attorney Schmidt will be filing proposed jury instructions.
Parties address masking procedures for trial.
Court reminds the defendant of right to testify or not testify.

21TR5416:
State calls Officer Gracia Larson of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
State moves to admit exhibit #1. Attorney Schmidt has no objection. Exhibit #1 is received.
Attorney Schmidt conducts cross-examination of Officer Larson. 
State conducts re-direct of Officer Larson.
Attorney Schmidt conducts re-cross-examination of Officer Larson. Witness excused.
State requests the Court find the refusal not reasonable.
Attorney Schmidt requests the Court find the refusal reasonable.
Court finds there was probable cause to arrest the defendant and orders the refusal is found not reasonable.
Attorney Schmidt requests the driver's license revocation not be entered until tomorrow. Court orders the driver's license revocation is ordered effective as of November 2, 2022 at 8 am.

State inquires how many strikes each side will have and both parties advise are requesting an alternate juror.
Court orders there will be 4 strikes per side and orders there will be an alternate juror.

Parties are ready to proceed to trial in 21CT216 as scheduled.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adding Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer on Count 3, thus elevating to a felony.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:30 PM cases 21CM652, 21CM785, 21CT216, 21CT314, 22CF636, 22CM29, 22CM326, 22CM475 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L. Anderson in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Brian L. Anderson. The defense has received a new offer from the State however the Defense would like to start scheduling the matters for trial. 
A substitution of judge has been filed in 22CF636. 
21CT216 is to be set for a two day trial and a final status conference. All other files, including the felony file are to ride along.
Initial Appearance, 06/10/2022
Initial Appearance, 06/10/2022
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases 21CM652, 21CM785, 21CT216, 21CT314, 22CM29, 22CM326, 22CF636, 22CM475 are called at 11:08 AM) Defendant Brian L. Anderson in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Brian L. Anderson.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF636, 22CM475. Defense withdraws request to modify bond at this time in 21CM652, 21CM785, 21CT216, 21CT314, 22CM29. State requests $1,000 cash bond to cover 22CF636, 22CM475. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $500 cash to cover 22CF636, 22CM475. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived in 22CF636. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/29/2022 at 2:30 PM. 
Hearing in 22CF636, 22CM475 and Status Conference in 21CM652, 21CM785, 21CT216, 21CT314, 22CM29: 8/4/2022 at 3:30 PM (Branch 2).

Defense requests to withdraw the motion. So ordered. Defense to file motion to modify bond at a later date.

21CT216 and 21CM652- Not Guilty pleas entered by Defendant. Court accepts Not Guilty pleas and forwards case to Branch 2 for further scheduling. 
Court advises Defendant of charges in 21CT314. Defense waives reading of the Complaint in 21CT314.
